channel.title: I am honestly about to cry
channel.description:
I have just spent hours modding allstars source. and Its soooo pro IMO.
But then! YOU'LL NEVER GUESS WHAT HAPPENED! NO1 CAN CONNECT TO IT. I HAVE UTORRENT DONE PORT FORWARDING I HAVE NO-IP AND I HAVE JDK IGT SAYS ITS ONLINE. AND EVERYTHING IN THE FREAKING TUTORIALS. BUT! NO1 CAN CONNECT! THEY CAN'T CONNECT TO ZENITHSCAPE.NO-IP.BIZ AND THEY CAN'T CONNECT TO [CODE]Your IP Address is 124.180.1.70[/CODE] but! YOU'LL NEVER GUESS I CAN CONNECT! OMG BUT ONLY WITH 127.0.0.1 AND THATS NOT HELPING ME IS IT. SORRY FOR THIS MESSAGE BEING ALL IN CAPS AND SARCASTIC AND STUFF BUT I THINK I BROKE MY KEYBOARD WITH ALL THE TEARS ON IT. SOMEONE PLEASE HELP ME!
:( no crying emotes

item.title: I am honestly about to cry
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

I actually had the same exact problem and heres how I fixed it:

Connect your router and type in 192.168.0.1 or 192.168.1.1 or your default gateway.
To find your default gateway go to your command prompt and type “ipconfig”. make sure you have
administrative access or it won’t work. (if your on vista)

It will ask you for a user and pass if you correctly connected your router.
some of the default username and passwords are:

U:admin
P:

U:admin
P:admin

U:
P:admin

You set your user and pass when configuring your router, it might be on your computer or somewhere in your home.

When you connect to your router, (I have D-link) click “portforward” or “applications and gaming”, or something similar to the two.
Now just open ports and click save.
Here is how I opened my ports:

Click the check
Name/application (I think thats what it is)

SERVER IP

Start port: 43594
End port: 43594

Drop down box
computer

pretty sure thats how I did it.
Then, I clicked “Save Settings”.

It worked for me that way, hopefully it works for you

Read full topic
item.source: I am honestly about to cry

item.title: I am honestly about to cry
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“FusionLord, post:25, topic:258556”]here if you have not figured it out
change this

s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
                String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

                if (/* connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")*/true) {
                    if (connectingHost.startsWith("computing")
                            || connectingHost.startsWith("server2")) {
                        misc.println(
                                connectingHost
                                        + ": Checking if server still is online...");
                    } else {
                        int Found = -1;

                        for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
                            if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
                                Found = ConnectionCount[i];
                                break;
                            }
                        }

to this

[code]
s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

            if (/* connectingHost.startsWith("ZENITHSCAPE.NO-IP.BIZ") || connectingHost.equals("ZENITHSCAPE.NO-IP.BIZ")*/true) {
                if (connectingHost.startsWith("computing")
                        || connectingHost.startsWith("server2")) {
                    misc.println(
                            connectingHost
                                    + ": Checking if server still is online...");
                } else {
                    int Found = -1;

                    for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
                        if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
                            Found = ConnectionCount[i];
                            break;
                        }
                    }

[/code][/quote]
Please do not grave dig a 2 month old topic.

Read full topic

                String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

item.description:
@Hypnoticweener wrote:

Maybe you could try setting urself as DMZ if you have a gateway or router or modem. worked for me.

allow access to these two programs

C:\program files\java\jre6\bin\java.exe
C:\windows\system32\java.exe

Hope it helps

item.title: I am honestly about to cry
item.dc:creator: @rune_mate99 rune mate99
item.description:
@rune_mate99 wrote:

[quote=“FusionLord, post:4, topic:258556”]both are in there

for port search:
serverlistenerPort

for ip search:
connectingHost[/quote]

Theres no variables for me to change there, it just is this.

[code]s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

            if (/* connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")*/true) {
                if (connectingHost.startsWith("computing")
                        || connectingHost.startsWith("server2")) {
                    misc.println(
                            connectingHost
                                    + ": Checking if server still is online...");
                } else {
                    int Found = -1;

                    for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
                        if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
                            Found = ConnectionCount[i];
                            break;
                        }
                    }[/code]

its calculated by s.getInetAdress() I can’t fiddle there? can I?

[quote=“FusionLord, post:6, topic:258556”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=341438.msg2642233#msg2642233 date=1232952902]
